member.name: T:RestSharp.OAuth2Authenticator
member.summary: Base class for OAuth 2 Authenticators.
member.remarks:
Since there are many ways to authenticate in OAuth2, this is used as a base class to differentiate between other authenticators.
Any other OAuth2 authenticators must derive from this abstract class.

member.name: F:RestSharp.OAuth2Authenticator._accessToken
member.summary: Access token to be used when authenticating.

member.name: M:RestSharp.OAuth2Authenticator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:RestSharp.OAuth2Authenticator.AccessToken
member.summary: Gets the access token.

member.name: T:RestSharp.OAuth2UriQueryParameterAuthenticator
member.summary: The OAuth 2 authenticator using URI query parameter.
member.remarks: Based on http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-10#section-5.1.2

member.name: M:RestSharp.OAuth2UriQueryParameterAuthenticator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:RestSharp.OAuth2AuthorizationRequestHeaderAuthenticator
member.summary: The OAuth 2 authenticator using the authorization request header field.
member.remarks: Based on http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-oauth-v2-10#section-5.1.1

member.name: F:RestSharp.OAuth2AuthorizationRequestHeaderAuthenticator._authorizationValue
member.summary: Stores the Authorization header value as "[tokenType] accessToken". used for performance.

member.name: M:RestSharp.OAuth2AuthorizationRequestHeaderAuthenticator.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:RestSharp.OAuth2AuthorizationRequestHeaderAuthenticator.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools._encoding
member.summary: All text parameters are UTF-8 encoded (per section 5.1).

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetNonce
member.summary: Generates a random 16-byte lowercase alphanumeric string.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetTimestamp
member.summary: Generates a timestamp based on the current elapsed seconds since '01/01/1970 0000 GMT"

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetTimestamp(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Generates a timestamp based on the elapsed seconds of a given time since '01/01/1970 0000 GMT"

member.name: F:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.UriRfc3986CharsToEscape
member.summary: The set of characters that are unreserved in RFC 2396 but are NOT unreserved in RFC 3986.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.UrlEncodeRelaxed(System.String)
member.summary: URL encodes a string based on section 5.1 of the OAuth spec. Namely, percent encoding with [RFC3986], avoiding unreserved characters, upper-casing hexadecimal characters, and UTF-8 encoding for text value pairs.
member.remarks: The method is supposed to take on RFC 3986 behavior if certain elements are present in a .config file. Even if this actually worked (which in my experiments it doesn't), we can't rely on every host actually having this configuration element present.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.UrlEncodeStrict(System.String)
member.summary: URL encodes a string based on section 5.1 of the OAuth spec. Namely, percent encoding with [RFC3986], avoiding unreserved characters, upper-casing hexadecimal characters, and UTF-8 encoding for text value pairs.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.NormalizeRequestParameters(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.WebParameterCollection)
member.summary: Sorts a collection of key-value pairs by name, and then value if equal, concatenating them into a single string. This string should be encoded prior to, or after normalization is run.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.SortParametersExcludingSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.WebParameterCollection)
member.summary: Sorts a by name, and then value if equal.
member.param: A collection of parameters to sort

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.ConstructRequestUrl(System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a request URL suitable for making OAuth requests. Resulting URLs must exclude port 80 or port 443 when accompanied by HTTP and HTTPS, respectively. Resulting URLs must be lower case.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.ConcatenateRequestElements(System.String,System.String,RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.WebParameterCollection)
member.summary: Creates a request elements concatentation value to send with a request. This is also known as the signature base.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureMethod,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a signature value given a signature base and the consumer secret. This method is used when the token secret is currently unknown.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureMethod,RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureTreatment,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a signature value given a signature base and the consumer secret. This method is used when the token secret is currently unknown.
member.param: The treatment to use on a signature value

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureMethod,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a signature value given a signature base and the consumer secret and a known token secret.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthTools.GetSignature(RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureMethod,RestSharp.Authenticators.OAuth.OAuthSignatureTreatment,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a signature value given a signature base and the consumer secret and a known token secret.
member.param: The treatment to use on a signature value

member.name: T:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CRC32
member.summary: Calculates a 32bit Cyclic Redundancy Checksum (CRC) using the same polynomial used by Zip. This type is used internally by DotNetZip; it is generally not used directly by applications wishing to create, read, or manipulate zip archive files.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CRC32.GetCrc32(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Returns the CRC32 for the specified stream.
member.param: The stream over which to calculate the CRC32

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CRC32.GetCrc32AndCopy(System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Returns the CRC32 for the specified stream, and writes the input into the output stream.
member.param: The stream over which to calculate the CRC32
The stream into which to deflate the input

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CRC32.ComputeCrc32(System.Int32,System.Byte)
member.summary: Get the CRC32 for the given (word,byte) combo. This is a computation defined by PKzip.
member.param: The byte to combine it with.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CRC32.SlurpBlock(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Update the value for the running CRC32 using the given block of bytes. This is useful when using the CRC32() class in a Stream.
member.param: how many bytes within the block to slurp

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CRC32.TotalBytesRead
member.summary: indicates the total number of bytes read on the CRC stream. This is used when writing the ZipDirEntry when compressing files.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CRC32.Crc32Result
member.summary: Indicates the current CRC for all blocks slurped in.

member.name: T:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CrcCalculatorStream
member.summary: A Stream that calculates a CRC32 (a checksum) on all bytes read, or on all bytes written.

remarks.para: This class can be used to verify the CRC of a ZipEntry when reading from a stream, or to calculate a CRC when writing to a stream. The stream should be used to either read, or write, but not both. If you intermix reads and writes, the results are not defined.
This class is intended primarily for use internally by the DotNetZip library.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CrcCalculatorStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: The default constructor.
member.remarks: Instances returned from this constructor will leave the underlying stream open upon Close().

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CrcCalculatorStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The constructor allows the caller to specify how to handle the underlying stream at close.
member.param: true to leave the underlying stream open upon close of the CrcCalculatorStream.; false otherwise.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CrcCalculatorStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64)
member.summary: A constructor allowing the specification of the length of the stream to read.
member.remarks: Instances returned from this constructor will leave the underlying stream open upon Close().
member.param: The length of the stream to slurp

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CrcCalculatorStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A constructor allowing the specification of the length of the stream to read, as well as whether to keep the underlying stream open upon Close().
member.param: The length of the stream to slurp
true to leave the underlying stream open upon close of the CrcCalculatorStream.; false otherwise.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CrcCalculatorStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Read from the stream
member.param: the offset at which to start
the number of bytes to read
member.returns: the number of bytes actually read

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CrcCalculatorStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Write to the stream.
member.param: the buffer from which to write
the offset at which to start writing
the number of bytes to write

member.summary: Flush the stream.

member.summary: Not implemented.

member.summary: Gets the total number of bytes run through the CRC32 calculator.
member.remarks: This is either the total number of bytes read, or the total number of bytes written, depending on the direction of this stream.

member.summary: Provides the current CRC for all blocks slurped in.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CrcCalculatorStream.LeaveOpen
member.summary: Indicates whether the underlying stream will be left open when the CrcCalculatorStream is Closed.

member.summary: Indicates whether the stream supports reading.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.CrcCalculatorStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Indicates whether the stream supports seeking.

member.name: T:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.FlushType
member.summary: Describes how to flush the current deflate operation.
member.remarks: The different FlushType values are useful when using a Deflate in a streaming application.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.FlushType.None
member.summary: No flush at all.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.FlushType.Partial
member.summary: Closes the current block, but doesn't flush it to the output. Used internally only in hypothetical scenarios. This was supposed to be removed by Zlib, but it is still in use in some edge cases.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.FlushType.Sync
member.summary: Use this during compression to specify that all pending output should be flushed to the output buffer and the output should be aligned on a byte boundary. You might use this in a streaming communication scenario, so that the decompressor can get all input data available so far. When using this with a ZlibCodec, AvailableBytesIn will be zero after the call if enough output space has been provided before the call. Flushing will degrade compression and so it should be used only when necessary.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.FlushType.Full
member.summary: Use this during compression to specify that all output should be flushed, as with FlushType.Sync, but also, the compression state should be reset so that decompression can restart from this point if previous compressed data has been damaged or if random access is desired. Using FlushType.Full too often can significantly degrade the compression.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.FlushType.Finish
member.summary: Signals the end of the compression/decompression stream.

member.name: T:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream
member.summary: A class for compressing and decompressing GZIP streams.

remarks.para: The GZipStream is a Decorator on a . It adds GZIP compression or decompression to any stream.

Like the Compression.GZipStream in the .NET Base Class Library, the Ionic.Zlib.GZipStream can compress while writing, or decompress while reading, but not vice versa. The compression method used is GZIP, which is documented in IETF RFC 1952, "GZIP file format specification version 4.3".
A GZipStream can be used to decompress data (through Read()) or to compress data (through Write()), but not both.

If you wish to use the GZipStream to compress data, you must wrap it around a write-able stream. As you call Write() on the GZipStream, the data will be compressed into the GZIP format. If you want to decompress data, you must wrap the GZipStream around a readable stream that contains an IETF RFC 1952-compliant stream. The data will be decompressed as you call Read() on the GZipStream.
Though the GZIP format allows data from multiple files to be concatenated together, this stream handles only a single segment of GZIP format, typically representing a single file.
This class is similar to and . ZlibStream handles RFC1950-compliant streams. handles RFC1951-compliant streams. This class handles RFC1952-compliant streams.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.LastModified
member.summary: The last modified time for the GZIP stream.
member.remarks: GZIP allows the storage of a last modified time with each GZIP entry. When compressing data, you can set this before the first call to Write(). When decompressing, you can retrieve this value any time after the first call to Read().

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Create a GZipStream using the specified CompressionMode and the specified CompressionLevel, and explicitly specify whether the stream should be left open after Deflation or Inflation.

remarks.para: This constructor allows the application to request that the captive stream remain open after the deflation or inflation occurs. By default, after Close() is called on the stream, the captive stream is also closed. In some cases this is not desired, for example if the stream is a memory stream that will be re-read after compressed data has been written to it. Specify true for the leaveOpen parameter to leave the stream open.

As noted in the class documentation, the CompressionMode (Compress or Decompress) also establishes the "direction" of the stream. A GZipStream with CompressionMode.Compress works only through Write(). A GZipStream with CompressionMode.Decompress works only through Read().

member.param: The stream which will be read or written.
Indicates whether the GZipStream will compress or decompress.
true if the application would like the stream to remain open after inflation/deflation.
A tuning knob to trade speed for effectiveness.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the stream.
member.remarks: This may or may not result in a Close() call on the captive stream. See the ctor's with leaveOpen parameters for more information.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.Flush
member.summary: Flush the stream.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Read and decompress data from the source stream.
member.remarks: With a GZipStream, decompression is done through reading.
member.param: The buffer into which the decompressed data should be placed.
the offset within that data array to put the first byte read.
the number of bytes to read.
member.returns: the number of bytes actually read

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Calling this method always throws a .

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Calling this method always throws a NotImplementedException.
member.param: irrelevant; this method will always throw!

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.Comment
member.summary: The Comment on the GZIP stream.

remarks.para: The GZIP format allows for each file to optionally have an associated comment stored with the file. The comment is encoded with the ISO-8859-1 code page. To include a comment in a GZIP stream you create, set this property before calling Write() for the first time on the GZipStream.

When using GZipStream to decompress, you can retrieve this property after the first call to Read(). If no comment has been set in the GZIP bytestream, the Comment property will return null (Nothing in VB).

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.FileName
member.summary: The FileName for the GZIP stream.

remarks.para: The GZIP format optionally allows each file to have an associated filename. When compressing data (through Write()), set this FileName before calling Write() the first time on the GZipStream. The actual filename is encoded into the GZIP bytestream with the ISO-8859-1 code page, according to RFC 1952. It is the application's responsibility to insure that the FileName can be encoded and decoded correctly with this code page.

When decompressing (through Read()), you can retrieve this value any time after the first Read(). In the case where there was no filename encoded into the GZIP bytestream, the property will return null (Nothing in VB).

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.Crc32
member.summary: The CRC on the GZIP stream.
member.remarks: This is used for internal error checking. You probably don't need to look at this property.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.FlushMode
member.summary: This property sets the flush behavior on the stream.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.BufferSize
member.summary: The size of the working buffer for the compression codec.

remarks.para: The working buffer is used for all stream operations. The default size is 1024 bytes. The minimum size is 128 bytes. You may get better performance with a larger buffer. Then again, you might not. You would have to test it.
Set this before the first call to Read() or Write() on the stream. If you try to set it afterwards, it will throw.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.TotalIn
member.summary: Returns the total number of bytes input so far.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.TotalOut
member.summary: Returns the total number of bytes output so far.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.CanRead
member.summary: Indicates whether the stream can be read.
member.remarks: The return value depends on whether the captive stream supports reading.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Indicates whether the stream supports Seek operations.
member.remarks: Always returns false.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Indicates whether the stream can be written.
member.remarks: The return value depends on whether the captive stream supports writing.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.Length
member.summary: Reading this property always throws a NotImplementedException.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.GZipStream.Position
member.summary: The position of the stream pointer.
member.remarks: Writing this property always throws a NotImplementedException. Reading will return the total bytes written out, if used in writing, or the total bytes read in, if used in reading. The count may refer to compressed bytes or uncompressed bytes, depending on how you've used the stream.

member.name: T:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibException
member.summary: A general purpose exception class for exceptions in the Zlib library.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibException.#ctor
member.summary: The ZlibException class captures exception information generated by the Zlib library.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: This ctor collects a message attached to the exception.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.SharedUtils.URShift(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs an unsigned bitwise right shift with the specified number
member.returns: The resulting number from the shift operation

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.SharedUtils.URShift(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs an unsigned bitwise right shift with the specified number
member.returns: The resulting number from the shift operation

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.SharedUtils.ReadInput(System.IO.TextReader,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a number of characters from the current source TextReader and writes the data to the target array at the specified index.
member.param: The source TextReader to read from
Contains the array of characteres read from the source TextReader.
The starting index of the target array.
The maximum number of characters to read from the source TextReader.
member.returns: The number of characters read. The number will be less than or equal to count depending on the data available in the source TextReader. Returns -1 if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: T:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.Adler
member.summary: Computes an Adler-32 checksum.
member.remarks: The Adler checksum is similar to a CRC checksum, but faster to compute, though less reliable. It is used in producing RFC1950 compressed streams. The Adler checksum is a required part of the "ZLIB" standard. Applications will almost never need to use this class directly.

member.name: T:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec
member.summary: Encoder and Decoder for ZLIB and DEFLATE (IETF RFC1950 and RFC1951).
member.remarks: This class compresses and decompresses data according to the Deflate algorithm and optionally, the ZLIB format, as documented in RFC 1950 - ZLIB and RFC 1951 - DEFLATE.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.InputBuffer
member.summary: The buffer from which data is taken.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.NextIn
member.summary: An index into the InputBuffer array, indicating where to start reading.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.AvailableBytesIn
member.summary: The number of bytes available in the InputBuffer, starting at NextIn.
member.remarks: Generally you should set this to InputBuffer.Length before the first Inflate() or Deflate() call. The class will update this number as calls to Inflate/Deflate are made.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.TotalBytesIn
member.summary: Total number of bytes read so far, through all calls to Inflate()/Deflate().

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.OutputBuffer
member.summary: Buffer to store output data.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.NextOut
member.summary: An index into the OutputBuffer array, indicating where to start writing.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.AvailableBytesOut
member.summary: The number of bytes available in the OutputBuffer, starting at NextOut.
member.remarks: Generally you should set this to OutputBuffer.Length before the first Inflate() or Deflate() call. The class will update this number as calls to Inflate/Deflate are made.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.TotalBytesOut
member.summary: Total number of bytes written to the output so far, through all calls to Inflate()/Deflate().

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.Message
member.summary: used for diagnostics, when something goes wrong!

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.WindowBits
member.summary: The number of Window Bits to use.
member.remarks: This gauges the size of the sliding window, and hence the compression effectiveness as well as memory consumption. It's best to just leave this setting alone if you don't know what it is. The maximum value is 15 bits, which implies a 32k window.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.#ctor
member.summary: Create a ZlibCodec that decompresses.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.InitializeInflate
member.summary: Initialize the inflation state.
member.remarks: It is not necessary to call this before using the ZlibCodec to inflate data; It is implicitly called when you call the constructor.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.InitializeInflate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize the inflation state with an explicit flag to govern the handling of RFC1950 header bytes.
member.remarks: By default, the ZLIB header defined in RFC 1950 is expected. If you want to read a zlib stream you should specify true for expectRfc1950Header. If you have a deflate stream, you will want to specify false. It is only necessary to invoke this initializer explicitly if you want to specify false.
member.param: whether to expect an RFC1950 header byte pair when reading the stream of data to be inflated.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.InitializeInflate(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initialize the ZlibCodec for inflation, with the specified number of window bits.
member.param: The number of window bits to use. If you need to ask what that is, then you shouldn't be calling this initializer.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.InitializeInflate(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize the inflation state with an explicit flag to govern the handling of RFC1950 header bytes.
member.remarks: If you want to read a zlib stream you should specify true for expectRfc1950Header. In this case, the library will expect to find a ZLIB header, as defined in RFC 1950, in the compressed stream. If you will be reading a DEFLATE or GZIP stream, which does not have such a header, you will want to specify false.
member.param: whether to expect an RFC1950 header byte pair when reading the stream of data to be inflated.
The number of window bits to use. If you need to ask what that is, then you shouldn't be calling this initializer.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.Inflate(RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.FlushType)
member.summary: Inflate the data in the InputBuffer, placing the result in the OutputBuffer.
member.remarks: You must have set InputBuffer and OutputBuffer, NextIn and NextOut, and AvailableBytesIn and AvailableBytesOut before calling this method.
member.param: The flush to use when inflating.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.EndInflate
member.summary: Ends an inflation session.
member.remarks: Call this after successively calling Inflate(). This will cause all buffers to be flushed. After calling this you cannot call Inflate() without a intervening call to one of the InitializeInflate() overloads.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.SyncInflate
member.summary: I don't know what this does!

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.SetDictionary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Set the dictionary to be used for either Inflation or Deflation.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibCodec.Adler32
member.summary: The Adler32 checksum on the data transferred through the codec so far. You probably don't need to look at this.

member.summary: A bunch of constants used in the Zlib interface.

member.summary: The maximum number of window bits for the Deflate algorithm.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibConstants.WindowBitsDefault
member.summary: The default number of window bits for the Deflate algorithm.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibConstants.Z_OK
member.summary: indicates everything is A-OK

member.summary: Indicates that the last operation reached the end of the stream.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibConstants.Z_NEED_DICT
member.summary: The operation ended in need of a dictionary.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibConstants.Z_STREAM_ERROR
member.summary: There was an error with the stream - not enough data, not open and readable, etc.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibConstants.Z_DATA_ERROR
member.summary: There was an error with the data - not enough data, bad data, etc.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibConstants.Z_BUF_ERROR
member.summary: There was an error with the working buffer.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibConstants.WorkingBufferSizeDefault
member.summary: The size of the working buffer used in the ZlibCodec class. Defaults to 8192 bytes.

member.name: F:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibConstants.WorkingBufferSizeMin
member.summary: The minimum size of the working buffer used in the ZlibCodec class. Currently it is 128 bytes.

member.name: T:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream
member.summary: Represents a Zlib stream for compression or decompression.

remarks.para: The ZlibStream is a Decorator on a . It adds ZLIB compression or decompression to any stream.

Using this stream, applications can compress or decompress data via stream Read and Write operations. Either compresssion or decompression can occur through either reading or writing. The compression format used is ZLIB, which is documented in IETF RFC 1950, "ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3". This implementation of ZLIB always uses DEFLATE as the compression method. (see IETF RFC 1951, "DEFLATE Compressed Data Format Specification version 1.3.")

The ZLIB format allows for varying compression methods, window sizes, and dictionaries. This implementation always uses the DEFLATE compression method, a preset dictionary, and 15 window bits by default.

This class is similar to , except that it adds the RFC1950 header and trailer bytes to a compressed stream when compressing, or expects the RFC1950 header and trailer bytes when decompressing. It is also similar to the .

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Dispose the stream.
member.remarks: This may or may not result in a Close() call on the captive stream. See the constructors that have a leaveOpen parameter for more information.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.Flush
member.summary: Flush the stream.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Read data from the stream.

remarks.para: If you wish to use the ZlibStream to compress data while reading, you can create a ZlibStream with CompressionMode.Compress, providing an uncompressed data stream. Then call Read() on that ZlibStream, and the data read will be compressed. If you wish to use the ZlibStream to decompress data while reading, you can create a ZlibStream with CompressionMode.Decompress, providing a readable compressed data stream. Then call Read() on that ZlibStream, and the data will be decompressed as it is read.
A ZlibStream can be used for Read() or Write(), but not both.

member.param: The buffer into which the read data should be placed.
the offset within that data array to put the first byte read.
the number of bytes to read.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Calling this method always throws a NotImplementedException.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Calling this method always throws a NotImplementedException.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Write data to the stream.

remarks.para: If you wish to use the ZlibStream to compress data while writing, you can create a ZlibStream with CompressionMode.Compress, and a writable output stream. Then call Write() on that ZlibStream, providing uncompressed data as input. The data sent to the output stream will be the compressed form of the data written. If you wish to use the ZlibStream to decompress data while writing, you can create a ZlibStream with CompressionMode.Decompress, and a writable output stream. Then call Write() on that stream, providing previously compressed data. The data sent to the output stream will be the decompressed form of the data written.
A ZlibStream can be used for Read() or Write(), but not both.

member.param: The buffer holding data to write to the stream.
the offset within that data array to find the first byte to write.
the number of bytes to write.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.UncompressString(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Uncompress a byte array into a single string.

member.name: M:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.UncompressBuffer(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Uncompress a byte array into a byte array.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.FlushMode
member.summary: This property sets the flush behavior on the stream. Sorry, though, not sure exactly how to describe all the various settings.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.BufferSize
member.summary: The size of the working buffer for the compression codec.

remarks.para: The working buffer is used for all stream operations. The default size is 1024 bytes. The minimum size is 128 bytes. You may get better performance with a larger buffer. Then again, you might not. You would have to test it.
Set this before the first call to Read() or Write() on the stream. If you try to set it afterwards, it will throw.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.TotalIn
member.summary: Returns the total number of bytes input so far.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.TotalOut
member.summary: Returns the total number of bytes output so far.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.CanRead
member.summary: Indicates whether the stream can be read.
member.remarks: The return value depends on whether the captive stream supports reading.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Indicates whether the stream supports Seek operations.
member.remarks: Always returns false.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Indicates whether the stream can be written.
member.remarks: The return value depends on whether the captive stream supports writing.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.Length
member.summary: Reading this property always throws a NotImplementedException.

member.name: P:RestSharp.Compression.ZLib.ZlibStream.Position
member.summary: The position of the stream pointer.
member.remarks: Writing this property always throws a NotImplementedException. Reading will return the total bytes written out, if used in writing, or the total bytes read in, if used in reading. The count may refer to compressed bytes or uncompressed bytes, depending on how you've used the stream.
